arundel.util

Class TopologicalSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • arundel.util.TopologicalSorter

  • public class TopologicalSorter
extends java.lang.Object

    Class to encapsulate the topological sorting algorithm. Instances of this class, sort the Gates in Circuit topologically and return them as a List<Gate>.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TopologicalSorter(Circuit dag)
      Constructs an instance of a TopologicalSorter from a Circuit

    • Constructor Detail

        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • visit

        public void visit(Gate g,
                  boolean topdown)

        Visits this Gates and its adjacent gates recursively, in order to order them in a topologically sorted manner. At first the parameter Gate is temporarily marked and all the Gates topologically below it are recursively visited. If in this process the temporarily marked gate is visited again, it is evident that there exists a cycle in the computation graph which is not permissible. Hence if a cycle is found a InvalidDAGException is thrown. If, however all the gates below the given gate are suceessfully visited, it is marked and is added to head of the list of sorted gates.

        Parameters:
        g - the gate to be visited
        topdown - order of queuing, true for topdown ordering, false for bottom up ordering
        Throws:
        arundel.util.InvalidDAGException - when a cycle is found

      • sort

        public java.util.List<Gate> sort(boolean topdown)
        Returns the sorted list of Gates as a List as a result of the sorting. It invokes visit(arundel.core.Gate, boolean) for every unmarked Gate in the Circuit.
        Parameters:
        topdown - true for top-down topological sorting, false for bottom-up topological sorting
        Returns:
        The sorted List of Gate
        Throws:
        arundel.util.InvalidDAGException - when a cycle is found

      • sort

        public java.util.List<Gate> sort()
        Returns the gates sorted topologically in a top-down ordering.
        Returns:
        sort(true)

      • getSorted

        public java.util.List<Gate> getSorted()
        Returns the cached sorted list of gates
        Returns:
        the cached list of gates
